definitions.definition: To repeatedly remind or complain to (someone) in an annoying way, often about insignificant or unnecessary matters.
To bother with persistent thoughts or memories.
examples: The notion that he forgot something nagged him the rest of the day.

definitions.definition: To bother or disturb persistently in any way.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To repeatedly remind or complain to (someone) in an annoying way, often about insignificant or unnecessary matters.
secondary_definitions: To bother with persistent thoughts or memories.
To bother or disturb persistently in any way.
